result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Revocation and Request for Civil Judgment on Remaining Court Costs (Imposed/Stayed Sentence)
Due date for assessment amended in CCAP to 5/25/2019 based on Order/entry of 3/6/2018.

Filed, signed Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations.  The court finds, orders, and adjudges that the defendant's probation is extended for 1 year, from 5/25/2018 to 5/25/2019, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.  This extension will serve the purposes for which probation was imposed.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 18, Judge Colon, for review.  jm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a restitution hearing.  Parties stipulated to the amount of $3,539.91.  The Court ORDERED restitution in the amount of $3,539.91 to victim, BMO Harris Bank.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.   

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Restitution to be determined by either a stipulation or a Court order and will be joint and several  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Obtain/maintain suitable employment 
-No contact with co-actors

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Curtis Bernard Caffey
Current: 2060 Van Deuren Street, Green Bay, WI 54302   (Effective: 11-25-2015)
Prior: 2933 North 2nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  David Robles appeared (via telephone) for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  The Court is currently in trial and not available.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and file.  Matter is adjourned to Novemebr 25, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for sentencing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing hearing.  Joint request for adjournment heard and granted by the Court; date selected.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Curtis Bernard Caffey appears in Court with Attorney Lori A Kuehn, who appears via telephone.  David Robles was contacted by the Clerk.  Due to the Court's unavailability, the matter has been adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 1:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a sentencing hearing.  All parties have been notified.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; filed.

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 08-14-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

All parties are notified that effective August  1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Jeffrey Conen, Branch 30,  in Room 635 of the Courthouse.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are working on a resolution.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-19-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Curtis Bernard Caffey in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-18-2015 at 08:30 am.
